items.sentence: I always watch the weather report before going out in the morning.
Tom says he wasn\'t here yesterday. It must\'ve been someone else.
Tom lived in Boston for three years before moving back to Chicago.
Tom might have survived if the paramedics had gotten there faster.
Tom opened the glove compartment and got out a pair of sunglasses.
Tom ought not to have spoken to his teacher in that tone of voice.
Tom wanted to prove to his friends and family that he could do it.
Though she did not wear expensive clothes, she was neatly dressed.
It might not have been as difficult to do that as Tom said it was.
You had just enough time to drive to Boston and commit the murder.
You should be ashamed of yourselves after the way you treated Tom.
Tom borrowed some books from the library to read over the weekend.
Tom and Mary just got married, but they don\'t act like newlyweds.
There weren\'t any passengers on the bus at the time of the crash.
Tom yelled something in French just before he dove into the water.
Tom wanted to take a picture of Mary, but she didn\'t want him to.
I thought I told you I didn\'t want you to talk to Tom about that.
I don\'t think that I\'ll be able to solve this problem by myself.
Tom asked his mother if he could spend the night at John\'s house.
Tom couldn\'t think of any reason for not giving Mary the present.
